title: Is each continent a floating island? Is there an ocean underneath each continent? - Quora

response.answer_text: In a sense the answer is yes although the correct answer is that although the earth's crust is solid with large liquid oceans the continents rest on large plates which in turn rest on the outer core. The boundaries of the plates move very slowly and so over a long period of time individual parts of the continents move relative to each other. As an example India is slowly moving North and the Himalayan mountain range has been formed by this movement. This movement is measured in millimetres per year. For more information search for Continental Drift.
No. Land masses are floating on top of a layer of liquid rock. And those places on the surface with lower altitude are fill with water, those we call oceans, lakes etc…
“Is each continent a floating island? Is there an ocean underneath each continent?” OMG, NO, whatever gave you that idea ? :)
